sen.j: 阿野家（あのけ）は、羽林家の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: The Ano family was a court noble with a family status of the Urin family.
The Ano family belonged to the court nobility and had a status of Urin.
The Ano family belonged to the court nobility and had a status of Urin.
Kanin-ryu (the Kanin family) of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
The Ano family was of the Kannin-ryu (the Kanin lineage) of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: I think a subject is required here.
sen.e: The Ano family was of the Kanin-ryu (the Kanin lineage) of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
The illegitimate family lineage of the Shigenoi family.
The Ano family is all of the illegitimate family lineate of the Shignoi family.
sen.cmt: I think a subject is required here.
sen.e: The Ano family is all of the illegitimate family lineate of the Shigenoi family.

sen.j: 阿野という名字は、元々源義朝の子で、源義経の同母兄である阿野全成が駿河国駿東郡阿野荘を根拠とし、その地名を取って阿野と号したものが始まりとされる。
sen.e: The family name Ano started when Zenjo ANO, who was the son of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo and the older brother with the same mother of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, identified himself as Ano based on Ano-sho, Sunto County, the Province of Suruga, where he based himself on.

The name Ano originated with Zenjo ANO, the son of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo and the older half-brother (with the same mother) of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, when he adopted the name Ano from Ano-sho, Sunto County in Suruga Province, where he was based.

The name Ano originated with Zenjo ANO, the son of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo and the older half-brother (with the same mother) of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, when he adopted the name Ano from Ano-sho, Sunto County in Suruga Province, where he was based.

sen.j: 一方、公家の阿野家は、藤原成親の子で滋野井実国の養子阿野公佐を祖として創設された。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Ano family of court noble was created by Kosa ANO, the son of FUJIWARA no Narichika who were adopted by Sanekuni SHIGENOI.
The Ano family in the court nobility, on the other hand, originated with Kosa ANO, the son of FUJIWARA no Narichika, who was adopted by Sanekuni SHIGENOI.
The Ano family in the court nobility, on the other hand, originated with Kosa ANO, the son of FUJIWARA no Narichika, who was adopted by Sanekuni SHIGENOI.

sen.j: 公佐がその岳父である前述の阿野全成から阿野荘の一部を相続したことに由来する。
sen.e: The name derived from the fact that Kosa inherited a part of Ano-sho from the above mentioned Zenjo ANO, who was his father in law.
The name derived from the fact that Kosa inherited a part of Ano-sho from the above-mentioned Zenjo ANO, who was his father in law.
The name derived from the fact that Kosa inherited a part of Ano-sho from the above-mentioned Zenjo ANO, who was his father in law.
The family business was Shinto music and dance numbers.
The family business was Shinto music and dance.
sen.cmt: I don't think "dance numbers" is appropriate here.
sen.e: The family business was Shinto music and dance.
The family crest was kara-hana (a kind of Chinese arabesque pattern).
The family crest was kara-hana (a kind of Chinese arabesque pattern).
The family crest was kara-hana (a kind of Chinese arabesque pattern).
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 478 koku.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 478 koku.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 478 koku.
The family of pedigree.
The Ano family had pedigree.
The Ano family had pedigree.
The outside daimyo.
The outside daimyo.
The family was the tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と用語合わせました。

sen.e: Became a viscount after the Meiji Restoration.
The family was awarded the title of viscount after the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: I think a subject is required here.
sen.e: The family was awarded the title of viscount after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の阿野公廉の娘阿野廉子は、後醍醐天皇の寵姫で、後村上天皇の生母となり、准三宮。
sen.e: Yasuko/Kadoko ANO, the daughter of Kinkado ANO in the Kamakura period, got affection from Emperor Godaigo and became the birth mother of Emperor Gomurakami, and jusangu, an honorary rank next to Emperor, Empress Dowager, and Empress, conferred on both men and women.

Yasuko/Kadoko ANO, the daughter of Kinkado ANO in the Kamakura period, was favored by Emperor Godaigo, gave birth to a son who would become Emperor Gomurakami, and was awarded the rank of jusangu, an honorary rank for those close to Emperor, Empress Dowager, and Empress, conferred on both men and women.
sen.cmt: Not sure what is meant by "an honorary rank next to Emperor, Empress Dowager and Empress". I have replaced "next to" with "for those close to" but this requires checking.
sen.e: Yasuko (her name is also pronounced Kadoko) ANO, the daughter of Kinkado ANO in the Kamakura period, was favored by the Emperor Godaigo, gave birth to a son who would become the Emperor Gomurakami, and was awarded the rank of jusangu, an honorary rank for those close to Emperor, Empress Dowager, and Empress, conferred on both men and women.
sen.cmt: (her name is also pronounced Kadoko) 補足"the" を挿入しました。

sen.j: 南北朝時代_(日本)には一族のほとんどが南朝_(日本)方に付くが、それが却って一族の分裂・弱体化を回避する事になり、南北朝合一後に京都に復帰した後も公家社会に留まる事を可能にしたという。
sen.e: Most of the family took the Southern Court side in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts; however, this actually helped the family avoid to breakup or weakened, and enabled the family to remain in the society of court noble when the family returned to Kyoto after the unification of the Northern and Southern Courts.

Most of the family took the Southern Court side in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, but this actually helped the family avoid to being broken up or weakened, which enabled it to remain part of the nobility on its return to Kyoto after the unification of the Northern and Southern Courts.

Most of the family took the Southern Court side in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, but this in fact helped the family avoid to being broken up or weakened, which enabled it to remain part of the nobility on its return to Kyoto after the unification of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: 分家に山本家（羽林家・維新後 子爵）、北大路家（男爵）、玉松家（男爵）がある。
sen.e: The Yamamoto family (the Urin family, and the viscount after the Restoration), the Kitaoji family (the baron), and the Tamamatsu family (the baron) were the branches of the family.

The Yamamoto family (which held the status of Urin, and the title of viscount after the Restoration), the Kitaoji family (which held a the title of baron), and the Tamamatsu family (which also held the title of baron) were the branches of the family.

The Yamamoto family (which held the status of Urin, and the title of viscount after the Restoration), the Kitaoji family (which held a the title of baron), and the Tamamatsu family (which also held the title of baron) were the branches of the family.
